alligator.name: American Alligator
alligator.habitat: Swamps, rivers, and lakes in the southeastern USA
alligator.size: Up to 13 feet long! That's about the length of a SCHOOL BUS!
alligator.diet: Carnivorous! They eat fish, birds, and even deer! BIG appetite!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 2,125 PSI
defenses: Can hold breath for over an hour
alligator.speed: Can run up to 20 mph on land! That's as fast as a speeding bicycle!
fun_facts: An alligator's heart can keep beating even after it's dead!
They can live for over 70 years!
Their eyes can see well underwater!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 13 feet long — about as long as a car! (13 feet)
WEIGHT: 1,000 pounds vs. 150 pounds

anaconda.name: Green Anaconda
anaconda.habitat: Swamps and rivers in South America
anaconda.size: Up to 30 feet long! That's longer than a SCHOOL BUS!
anaconda.diet: Carnivore! They eat fish, birds, and even CAPYBARAS!
defenses: Ability to hold breath for up to 10 minutes
anaconda.speed: Can swim at 1.5 mph, like a slow jog!
fun_facts: Can weigh over 500 pounds! That's like a small car!
They can swallow prey whole!
They can stay underwater for long periods!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 25 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (25 feet)
Can be 5 times longer than you!

ankylosaurus.name: Ankylosaurus
ankylosaurus.habitat: FORESTS and PLAINS of the Late Cretaceous period
ankylosaurus.size: AN KYLOSAURUS was about 26 feet long!
ankylosaurus.diet: HERBIVORE! It munched on LOW GROWING PLANTS and FERN.
ankylosaurus.speed: TOP SPEED of 8 mph! That's like a SLOW RUNNING KID!
fun_facts: AN KYLOSAURUS could weigh as much as 6 TONNES! That's like 3 CARS!
It had a BONE-HEADED HEAD for protection!
Its armor was like a living TANK!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 26 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (26 feet)
Weighing up to 6 tons is like 3 SEDANS!

basilisk.name: Basilisk
basilisk.size: Up to 10 feet long! That's like 2 school buses lined up!
basilisk.diet: Carnivorous! It eats small animals and birds, using its deadly gaze to hunt!
weapons: Deadly gaze (can turn creatures to stone)
basilisk.speed: Can sprint up to 30 mph! That's as fast as a cheetah!
fun_facts: Basilisks are known as the 'King of Serpents'!
They can live for hundreds of years!
Their gaze is so powerful, it can kill just by looking!

size_comparisons.comparison: 10 feet long is about 1/3 of a school bus!
10 feet long is almost 2 people stacked on top of each other!

black-panther.name: Black Panther
black-panther.habitat: Rainforests, savannas, and grasslands in Africa and Asia
black-panther.size: 4 to 6 feet long (1.2 to 1.8 meters) PLUS about as long as a sedan!
black-panther.diet: Carnivore! They eat deer, monkeys, and birds. They are great hunters!
black-panther.speed: Top speed of 35 mph, FASTER than a running human!
fun_facts: A BLACK PANTHER is actually a LEOPARD with dark fur!
They can leap up to 20 feet in a single jump!
Their night vision is SIX TIMES better than humans!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 7 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
About the same WEIGHT as a large dog, around 100 to 200 pounds!

brachiosaurus.name: Brachiosaurus
brachiosaurus.diet: Herbivore! Brachiosaurus loved to munch on TREES and LEAVES high up in the canopy.
defenses: Size! It's hard to attack something so BIG!
brachiosaurus.speed: Top speed of 10 miles per hour! That's like running as fast as a person on a bike!
fun_facts: Brachiosaurus had longer front legs than back legs, making it stand tall!
It could eat up to 880 pounds of plants a day!
Its name means 'ARM LIZARD' because of its long arms!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 85 feet long — almost as long as a basketball court! (85 feet)
WEIGHT: About 62 tons, which is like 15 cars!

cape-buffalo.name: Cape Buffalo
cape-buffalo.size: Up to 11.5 feet long! That's like 1/3 of a school bus! They stand about 5.5 feet tall at the shoulder.!
cape-buffalo.diet: Herbivore! They munch on grass and leaves. They need to eat a LOT to stay strong!
cape-buffalo.speed: Can run up to 30 mph! That's as fast as a cheetah for short bursts!
fun_facts: A Cape Buffalo can weigh as much as a small car—up to 2,000 pounds!
They are known as 'Black Death' because they are so tough!
Cape Buffalos have a strong social bond and live in herds.

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 11 feet long — about as long as a small car! (11 feet)
As heavy as a small car in WEIGHT

cassowary.name: Cassowary
cassowary.habitat: Tropical rainforests of New Guinea, nearby islands, and northern Australia.
cassowary.size: Up to 6 feet tall! That's as tall as a door!
cassowary.diet: Fruits, seeds, and small animals. They LOVE berries!
weapons: Powerful legs with claws up to 5 inches long
cassowary.speed: Can run up to 30 miles per hour! That's faster than a cheetah for short bursts!
fun_facts: Their blue skin is SUPER unique!
They can jump up to 5 feet high!
Cassowaries are known as the 'world's most dangerous bird'!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 6 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
About the same height as a tall person (6 feet)

cerberus.name: Cerberus
cerberus.habitat: The Underworld, guarding the gates of Hades
cerberus.size: About 30 feet long! That's almost as long as a school bus!
cerberus.diet: Carnivore! Cerberus eats anything that tries to escape the Underworld!
weapons: Three fierce heads, each about 3 feet wide
defenses: Ability to intimidate with three heads
cerberus.speed: Can run up to 25 miles per hour! That's as fast as a cheetah!
fun_facts: Each head can bite at the same time! That's THREE bites!
Cerberus is often depicted with a serpent for a tail!
He can scare off even the bravest heroes!

size_comparisons.comparison: 30 feet long, almost as long as a school bus!
Each head is about the size of a person!

cheetah.name: Cheetah
cheetah.size: Up to 4.5 feet tall at the shoulder and 3.5 to 4.5 feet long. That's about the length of a small sedan!
cheetah.diet: Carnivorous! They eat small to medium-sized animals like gazelles and impalas. They need to eat every day to stay strong!
cheetah.speed: Top speed of 60 to 70 mph! That's faster than a school bus on the highway!
fun_facts: Cheetahs can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 3 seconds!
They have distinctive black tear marks under their eyes to reduce glare from the sun.
Cheetahs can only maintain their top speed for about 20-30 seconds!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 7.5 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
Weight: 110 to 140 pounds, similar to a tall person!

chimera.name: Chimera
chimera.size: About 10 feet long! That's like 2 school buses stacked end to end!
chimera.diet: Carnivorous! It eats anything from goats to humans!
defenses: Scaly hide (as tough as a dragon's)
Can roar to scare off enemies
chimera.speed: Can run up to 30 miles per hour! That's as fast as a cheetah!
fun_facts: It has the head of a lion, the body of a goat, and a tail that ends with a snake!
Chimeras are often considered a symbol of chaos!
They can breathe fire, just like dragons!

size_comparisons.comparison: 2 school buses long (70 feet total)
About 2 people tall (12 feet total)

crocodile.name: Saltwater Crocodile
crocodile.diet: Carnivore! They eat fish, birds, and even large mammals!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 3,700 pounds!
crocodile.speed: Can swim up to 20 mph! That's as fast as a running dog!
fun_facts: They can hold their breath for over an hour!
Saltwater crocodiles are the largest reptiles on Earth!
They can live for over 70 years!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 20 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (20 feet)
Weighs up to 2,200 pounds, that's like 4 average-sized people!

dragon.name: Fire-Breathing Dragon
dragon.size: 30 feet long (about the length of a school bus!)
dragon.diet: Carnivorous! They feast on large animals like deer and even other dragons!
defenses: Flight (can soar high in the sky)
dragon.speed: Top speed of 60 mph (as fast as a cheetah!)
fun_facts: A dragon's wingspan can reach 60 feet—WIDER than a school bus!
Some legends say they can live for over 1,000 years!
They can carry up to 1,000 pounds in flight!

size_comparisons.comparison: 30 feet long, the same length as a school bus!
Weighs around 1,500 pounds, similar to a large elephant!

eagle.name: Bald Eagle
eagle.habitat: Near large bodies of open water with abundant food supply and old-growth trees for nesting.
eagle.size: Wingspan of up to 7.5 feet! That's longer than a sedan (15 feet) laid on its side!
eagle.diet: Carnivorous! They primarily eat fish, but will also hunt small mammals and birds.
defenses: Nesting high up to avoid predators
eagle.speed: Can dive at speeds of 30-40 mph! That's as fast as a car on the highway!
fun_facts: Their nest can be as big as a small car!
Bald Eagles can live up to 30 years in the wild!
They can see four to five times better than humans.

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 3.5 feet long — about as long as a baseball bat!
Height is about 1/2 the height of an average person (5.5-6 feet)!

elephant.name: African Elephant
elephant.habitat: Savannas, forests, and grasslands in Africa
elephant.size: Up to 13 feet tall at the shoulder and 24 feet long! That's as long as TWO SCHOOL BUSES!
elephant.diet: Herbivore! They eat grass, leaves, fruits, and bark. An adult can consume up to 300 POUNDS of food a day!
elephant.speed: Can run up to 25 mph! That's as fast as a running horse!
fun_facts: An elephant's trunk has over 40,000 muscles!
Elephants can communicate using infrasound, which is below human hearing!
They can live up to 70 years!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 22 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (22 feet)
WEIGHT: An adult elephant can weigh as much as 6 cars!

gorilla.name: Gorilla
gorilla.size: Up to 6 feet tall and 12 feet long when standing on all fours! That's as tall as a door!
gorilla.diet: Herbivore! Gorillas eat leaves, stems, fruit, and flowers. They munch on over 100 different types of plants!
weapons: Strong arms with a reach of 8 feet
gorilla.speed: Can run up to 20 miles per hour! That's as fast as a speeding car in a school zone!
fun_facts: A male gorilla can weigh up to 400 pounds! That's like carrying a small child!
Gorillas are 98% genetically similar to humans!
They can communicate using over 25 different sounds!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 5.5 feet long — about as long as a bathtub!
A gorilla can be over 1 foot taller than an average person!

great-white-shark.name: Great White Shark
great-white-shark.habitat: Oceans worldwide, especially in coastal waters
great-white-shark.diet: Carnivorous! They eat seals, fish, and even other sharks!
weapons: Jaws with 300 sharp teeth, each up to 3 inches long!
defenses: Ability to sense blood from miles away
great-white-shark.speed: Can swim up to 25 miles per hour! That's faster than a speeding car!
fun_facts: Their bite is stronger than a T-Rex's!
Great Whites can detect a drop of blood in 25 gallons of water!
They can leap out of the water like a dolphin!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 20 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (20 feet)
Can weigh over 2,400 pounds, heavier than a sedan!

griffin.name: Griffin
griffin.size: About 13 feet long and 6 feet tall at the shoulder! That's like a small car!
griffin.diet: Carnivorous! They love to eat fish, deer, and even horses!
griffin.speed: Can fly up to 30 miles per hour! That's as fast as a speeding car!
fun_facts: A Griffin has the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle!
They are known as guardians of treasures!
Griffins are symbols of strength and courage!

size_comparisons.comparison: About 1/3 the length of a school bus!
As tall as a person standing on their tiptoes!

grizzly-bear.name: Grizzly Bear
grizzly-bear.habitat: Forests, mountains, and national parks in North America
grizzly-bear.size: Up to 8 feet long! That's as long as a SCHOOL BUS!
grizzly-bear.diet: Omnivorous! They eat berries, fish, and even small mammals!
grizzly-bear.speed: Can run up to 30 mph! That's faster than a CHEETAH for short bursts!
fun_facts: A Grizzly's sense of smell is 7 times better than a bloodhound!
They can weigh up to 1,500 pounds, as heavy as a small CAR!
Grizzlies can hibernate for up to 7 months!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 8 feet long — about as long as a small car! (8 feet)
Weight: 1,500 pounds = as heavy as a small CAR!

hippo.name: Common Hippopotamus
hippo.diet: Herbivore! They eat grass, munching up to 150 pounds a night!
defenses: Can hold breath underwater for 5 minutes
hippo.speed: Can run up to 19 mph! That's faster than most kids can sprint!
fun_facts: Hippos are the third largest land mammals!
They can open their mouths 150 degrees wide!
Hippos spend most of the day in water to keep cool!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 16 feet long — about as long as a car! (16 feet)
Weighs up to 4,000 pounds, that's like 2 cars!

honey-badger.name: Honey Badger
honey-badger.habitat: Savannas, forests, and grasslands in Africa and Asia
honey-badger.size: About 30 inches long (2.5 feet) - That's like a medium-sized dog!
honey-badger.diet: Carnivorous! They eat snakes, insects, and even honey. They LOVE honey!
honey-badger.speed: Can run up to 19 miles per hour - That's as fast as a fast jogger!
fun_facts: Honey badgers are known to chase away lions!
They can survive snake bites!
They're called the 'most fearless animal' in the world!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 2.5 feet long — about as long as a baseball bat!
1/3 the HEIGHT of a person (5.5-6 feet)

hydra.name: Hydra
hydra.habitat: Swamps and lakes in ancient Greece
hydra.size: Up to 30 feet long! That's like 1.5 school buses!
hydra.diet: Carnivorous! The Hydra loves to eat livestock and heroes who dare to challenge it!
defenses: Regeneration (grows two heads for every one cut off)
hydra.speed: Can swim quickly at 10 mph! That's as fast as a running dog!
fun_facts: The Hydra has multiple heads—sometimes up to 9!
It was defeated by Hercules in a legendary battle!
Its breath is so toxic, it can kill just by being near it!

size_comparisons.comparison: 30 feet long is like 1.5 school buses!
30 feet long is 5 times the height of an average person!

hyena.name: Spotted Hyena
hyena.habitat: Savannas, grasslands, and woodlands in Africa
hyena.size: Up to 4.5 feet tall at the shoulder and 5.5 to 6.5 feet long! That's about as long as a small sedan!
hyena.diet: Carnivorous! They eat meat, including wildebeest, zebras, and even leftovers from other predators!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 1,100 PSI!
defenses: Intimidating laugh to scare off threats
hyena.speed: Can run up to 37 miles per hour! That's faster than a speeding car in a school zone!
fun_facts: A group of hyenas is called a 'clan'—it can have up to 80 members!
Hyenas are more closely related to cats than dogs!
They can eat bones—nothing goes to waste!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 5 feet long — about as long as a bathtub!
About as tall as a person standing on their tiptoes!

jaguar.name: Jaguar
jaguar.habitat: Rainforests, swamps, and grasslands in Central and South America
jaguar.size: Up to 6 feet long! That's as long as a school bus is tall!
jaguar.diet: Carnivore! Jaguars love to eat deer, capybaras, and even caimans!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 1,500 PSI
jaguar.speed: Can run up to 50 miles per hour! That's faster than a speeding car in a school zone!
fun_facts: Jaguars are the third largest big cat in the world!
They can swim really well and love water!
Their spots are called rosettes and help them blend in!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 6 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
A jaguar can weigh up to 250 pounds, which is like 2 average-sized kids!

king-cobra.name: King Cobra
king-cobra.habitat: Tropical forests and grasslands in Southeast Asia
king-cobra.size: Up to 18 feet long! That's as long as a SCHOOL BUS!
king-cobra.diet: Eats other snakes, including venomous ones! They can consume prey up to 1/3 of their body length.
defenses: Can stand tall and spread hood
king-cobra.speed: Can slither at speeds of 3 miles per hour! That's as fast as a walking person!
fun_facts: Their venom can kill an elephant!
They can live up to 20 years in the wild!
King Cobras are the longest venomous snakes in the world!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 18 feet long — about as long as a car! (18 feet)
WEIGHT: Up to 20 pounds, like a small dog!

komodo-dragon.name: Komodo Dragon
komodo-dragon.size: Up to 10 feet long! That's as long as a SCHOOL BUS!
komodo-dragon.diet: Carnivorous! They eat deer, birds, and even smaller Komodo dragons!
weapons: Powerful jaws with 60 sharp teeth (up to 1 inch long)
komodo-dragon.speed: Can run up to 13 miles per hour! That's as fast as a speedy SEDAN!
fun_facts: Their saliva contains bacteria that can infect prey!
They can eat up to 80% of their body weight in one meal!
They can sense rotting meat from miles away!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 10 feet long — about as long as a small car! (10 feet)
Can weigh around 150 pounds, like a SMALL CHILD!

kraken.name: Kraken
kraken.size: Up to 100 feet long! That's like THREE SCHOOL BUSES!
kraken.diet: Carnivorous! It eats large fish, whales, and even ships!
kraken.speed: Can swim at speeds of 25 mph! That's faster than a speeding car!
fun_facts: The Kraken is BIGGER than most dinosaurs!
Some legends say it can pull down entire ships!
It can live for hundreds of years!

size_comparisons.comparison: 100 feet long is like 3 school buses!
Weighs as much as 10 elephants!

leopard.name: Leopard
leopard.size: LEOPARDS CAN BE UP TO 6.25 FEET LONG! THAT'S LIKE A SMALL SCHOOL BUS! They weigh between 66 to 176 pounds, which is about as heavy as a large dog!
leopard.diet: LEOPARDS ARE CARNIVORES! They eat deer, antelope, and even monkeys! They are skilled hunters!
leopard.speed: LEOPARDS CAN RUN UP TO 36 MPH! THAT'S FASTER THAN A CHEETAH OVER SHORT DISTANCES!
fun_facts: LEOPARDS CAN JUMP 10 FEET HIGH! THAT'S LIKE JUMPING OVER A CAR!
THEY ARE GREAT SWIMMERS!
LEOPARDS OFTEN DRAG THEIR PREY UP INTO TREES TO KEEP IT SAFE!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 6.25 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
WEIGHING UP TO 176 POUNDS IS LIKE A LARGE DOG!

lion.name: Lion
lion.habitat: Grasslands, savannas, and open woodlands in Africa and India
lion.size: Adult male lions can weigh up to 420 pounds and measure about 8 to 10 feet long from nose to tail! That's as long as a school bus!
lion.diet: Lions are carnivores! They eat large animals like zebras, wildebeests, and buffalo. They hunt in groups called prides!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 650 PSI
Sharp claws up to 1.5 inches long
defenses: Thick mane to protect their necks
Group living for safety in numbers
lion.speed: Lions can run up to 50 miles per hour for short bursts! That's as fast as a speeding car in a neighborhood!
fun_facts: A lion's roar can be heard up to 5 miles away!
Lions sleep for about 20 hours a day!
A group of lions is called a pride!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 9 feet long — about as long as a small car! (9 feet)
weighs as much as 2 to 3 adult humans

manticore.name: Manticore
manticore.size: About 10 feet long! That's like 2 school buses lined up!
manticore.diet: Carnivorous! They feast on humans, livestock, and anything they can catch!
weapons: Tail with venomous spikes (up to 3 feet long)
defenses: Ability to mimic sounds to confuse prey
manticore.speed: Can run up to 30 mph! That's as fast as a cheetah!
fun_facts: Manticore means 'man-eater' in Persian!
They have the body of a lion, a human head, and a scorpion tail!
They can shoot their tail spikes like arrows!

size_comparisons.comparison: 10 feet long is about 1/3 of a school bus!
10 feet long is about 2 times the height of an average person!

moose.name: Moose
moose.habitat: Forests and wetlands in North America and parts of Europe and Asia
moose.size: 6 to 7.5 feet tall at the shoulder! That's as tall as a DOORWAY!
moose.diet: Herbivore! Moose LOVE to munch on leaves, twigs, and aquatic plants.
moose.speed: Can run up to 35 mph! That's as fast as a speeding CAR!
fun_facts: Moose can dive 20 feet underwater to eat plants!
Their antlers can weigh as much as 100 pounds!
Moose have a special flap of skin called a 'bell' under their throat.

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 10 feet long — about as long as a small car! (10 feet)
A moose is about 1.5 times taller than an adult human!

octopus.name: Common Octopus
octopus.habitat: Oceans and seas around the world
octopus.size: Up to 3.5 feet long! That's about the length of a SCHOOL BUS! (35 feet)!
octopus.diet: Carnivorous! They eat crabs, fish, and mollusks. They use their beaks to CRACK open shells!
octopus.speed: Can swim up to 25 miles per hour! That's like running faster than a cheetah for a short burst!
fun_facts: An octopus has THREE HEARTS!
They can squeeze through ANY opening bigger than their beak!
Octopuses have blue blood!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 5 feet long — about as long as a bathtub!
3.5 feet long vs. 5.5-6 feet tall

orca.name: Orca
orca.habitat: Oceans worldwide, especially in colder waters
orca.diet: Carnivorous! They eat fish, seals, and even whales! Orcas are TOP PREDATORS!
weapons: Powerful jaws with 40-56 teeth, each up to 4 inches long
defenses: Camouflage with black and white coloring
orca.speed: Can swim up to 34.5 mph! That's faster than a cheetah on land!
fun_facts: Orcas are actually dolphins!
They can dive over 1,000 feet deep!
Orcas have unique calls like a fingerprint!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 26 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (26 feet)
Weighs up to 12,000 pounds, that's like 2 cars!

phoenix.name: Phoenix
phoenix.size: About 15 feet long! That's as long as a SEDAN!
phoenix.diet: Phoenixes are said to feed on sunlight and fire! They absorb energy from flames.
phoenix.speed: Can fly up to 100 mph! That's faster than a CAR on the highway!
fun_facts: A Phoenix can live for hundreds of years!
When it dies, it bursts into flames and is reborn!
Its feathers can glow like the sun!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: 15 feet is almost half the length of a school bus!
WEIGHT: A Phoenix could weigh as much as 200 pounds, like a large dog!

polar-bear.name: Polar Bear
polar-bear.habitat: Arctic regions, mainly on sea ice
polar-bear.diet: Carnivorous! They eat seals, fish, and sometimes even birds.
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 1,200 PSI
Sharp claws up to 2 inches long
polar-bear.speed: Can run up to 25 miles per hour! That's as fast as a car in a school zone!
fun_facts: Their fur isn't white; it's actually transparent!
Polar bears can overheat in warm weather!
They have a great sense of smell, detecting seals nearly a mile away!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 9 feet long — about as long as a small car! (9 feet)
Weighs up to 1,500 pounds, like a small car!

pteranodon.name: Pteranodon
pteranodon.size: Wingspan of up to 33 feet! That's longer than a SCHOOL BUS!
pteranodon.diet: Fish and squid! Pteranodon was a skilled fisherman, diving to catch its meals.
pteranodon.speed: Can soar at speeds of 25 mph! That's as fast as a RUNNING DOG!
fun_facts: Pteranodon had a crest on its head that could be over 2 feet tall!
It lived during the Late Cretaceous period, around 70 million years ago!
Pteranodon is NOT a dinosaur, but a flying reptile!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 20 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (20 feet)
Beak length of 3 feet, as long as a TALL PERSON!

python.name: Green Python
python.habitat: Tropical rainforests of New Guinea and Australia
python.diet: Carnivore! They eat small mammals and birds, using their powerful constriction to catch prey.
weapons: Strong muscles for constriction (up to 1 foot in diameter)
python.speed: Can strike at speeds of 3 mph! That's like running as fast as a slow jogger!
fun_facts: Their scales can be bright green, making them look like leaves!
They can live up to 20 years in captivity!
They are excellent climbers, spending most of their time in trees.

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 20 feet long — longer than a car but shorter than a school bus! (20 feet)
13 feet is more than 2 people stacked on top of each other!

rhino.name: White Rhino
rhino.diet: Herbivore! They munch on grass and leaves, using their wide mouths to graze.
rhino.speed: Top speed of 30 mph! That's like running as fast as a cheetah for short bursts!
fun_facts: A White Rhino can weigh up to 2,300 kg! That's like 3 cars!
They have poor eyesight but a great sense of smell!
Rhinos can live up to 40 years in the wild!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 13 feet long — about as long as a car! (13 feet)
Weighs as much as 3 sedans! (2,300 kg)

spinosaurus.name: Spinosaurus
spinosaurus.habitat: Rivers and wetlands of North Africa
spinosaurus.size: Up to 50-59 feet long! That's like TWO SCHOOL BUSES!
spinosaurus.diet: Carnivore! It ate fish and possibly other dinosaurs. Think of it as a giant, hungry crocodile!
spinosaurus.speed: Could run up to 12 miles per hour! That's like running as fast as a cheetah for short bursts!
fun_facts: Its sail could be over 6 feet tall! That's taller than a person!
Spinosaurus might have been the largest carnivorous dinosaur!
It had a long, crocodile-like snout for catching fish.

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 50 feet long — longer than a school bus! (50 feet)
WEIGHT: Estimated 7-20 tons, like 2-3 cars!

stegosaurus.name: Stegosaurus
stegosaurus.diet: Herbivore! It munches on plants, leaves, and ferns.
stegosaurus.speed: Can run up to 5 miles per hour! That's like a slow jog!
fun_facts: Its plates could be as tall as a person!
Stegosaurus had a tiny brain for its size!
Its tail spikes were called a 'thagomizer'!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 30 feet long — about as long as a school bus! (30 feet)
Weighed about as much as 2 cars (around 5 tons)

tiger.name: Tiger
tiger.habitat: Tropical forests, grasslands, and swamps in Asia
tiger.size: Up to 10 feet long including the tail! That's as long as a SCHOOL BUS!
tiger.diet: Carnivore! Tigers eat deer, wild boar, and even buffalo. They need a LOT of meat!
weapons: Powerful jaws with a bite force of 1,000 PSI
Sharp claws up to 3 inches long
defenses: Silent stalker - they can sneak up on prey!
tiger.speed: Can run up to 30 miles per hour! That's as fast as a speeding CAR!
fun_facts: A tiger's roar can be heard up to 2 miles away!
They are excellent swimmers and love water!
Each tiger has a unique stripe pattern, just like fingerprints!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 10 feet long — about as long as a small car! (10 feet)
Weighs between 220 to 660 pounds! That's like 2 to 3 people!

triceratops.name: Triceratops
triceratops.habitat: Open plains and forests in North America
triceratops.diet: Herbivore! Triceratops loved munching on tough plants and shrubs.
triceratops.speed: Top speed of 20 mph! That's like running as fast as a cheetah for a short burst!
fun_facts: Triceratops weighed about 12 tons! That's like 3 elephants!
They had a beak like a parrot!
Some had frills with unique patterns!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 30 feet long — about as long as a school bus! (30 feet)
Weighed around 12 tons! That's like 3 elephants!

tyrannosaurus-rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
tyrannosaurus-rex.habitat: Forests and plains of North America
tyrannosaurus-rex.size: 40 feet long! Stands 12 feet tall at the hips!
tyrannosaurus-rex.diet: Carnivore! It eats large prey like Triceratops and Edmontosaurus. BIG MEALS!
weapons: Sharp claws on its tiny arms
defenses: Massive size to scare off predators
Incredible sense of smell to detect danger
tyrannosaurus-rex.speed: Top speed of 20 mph! That's like running as fast as a cheetah for short bursts!
fun_facts: Its bite force is the strongest of any land animal ever! WOW!
T. rex lived around 68 to 66 million years ago!
It had excellent vision, possibly better than an eagle!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 40 feet long — longer than a school bus! (40 feet)
Weighed about 9 tons, like 2 cars!

velociraptor.name: Velociraptor
velociraptor.habitat: Dry, open areas like deserts and plains
velociraptor.size: About 6.5 feet long! That's like a small car! (A sedan is ~15 feet)!
velociraptor.diet: Carnivore! They eat meat, hunting small dinosaurs and other animals.
velociraptor.speed: Top speed of 24 mph! That's faster than a human sprinter!
fun_facts: They were about the size of a turkey!
Velociraptors had feathers!
They may have hunted in packs!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 6 feet long — about as tall as a grown-up — or a door!
6.5 feet is about the same height as a tall person!

walrus.name: Walrus
walrus.diet: Walruses are mostly carnivores. They LOVE clams, mollusks, and other sea creatures!
walrus.speed: Can swim up to 35 mph! That's like a speeding car on the highway!
fun_facts: A walrus can weigh as much as a small car!
They can hold their breath for up to 30 minutes!
Walruses can be very social and gather in large groups!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 12 feet long — about as long as a car! (12 feet)
Can weigh up to 2,000 pounds, that's like 4 sedans!

wolf.name: Gray Wolf
wolf.size: Up to 6.5 feet long (including tail) - ABOUT AS LONG AS A SCHOOL BUS!
wolf.diet: Carnivorous! They eat deer, elk, and smaller animals. They hunt in PACKS!
wolf.speed: Can run up to 40 mph - FASTER THAN A SPRINTING HUMAN!
fun_facts: Wolves can howl up to 6 miles away!
A wolf's sense of smell is 100 times better than a human's!
They can travel over 30 miles in a day!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 5 feet long — about as long as a bathtub!
Weight: 50-110 pounds, similar to a child!

wolverine.name: Wolverine
wolverine.habitat: Cold forests and tundras of North America and Eurasia
wolverine.size: 26 to 34 inches long (about the length of a small dog) and 24 inches tall at the shoulder!
wolverine.diet: Carnivorous! Wolverines eat small mammals, birds, and even carrion. They are known to take down prey larger than themselves!
wolverine.speed: Top speed of 30 miles per hour (as fast as a running human!)
fun_facts: Wolverines can weigh up to 25-30 pounds (like a large dog)!
They can travel over 15 miles in a day searching for food!
Wolverines are known for their strength and can take down prey much larger than themselves!

size_comparisons.comparison: LENGTH: About 3.5 feet long — about as long as a baseball bat!
About half the height of a person (5.5-6 feet)
